page.title: 16HALLATON: MAY DAY AND PUBS
page.content: On May Day Bank Holiday the tradition of{crowning the May Queen}is carried on, organised by the Guides. A cart or decorated van leaves the Stenning Hall with the May Queen and her attendants (children from the village school) behind a guard of honour of guides. They make their way to the Butter Cross where the May Queen is crowned. Then follows a fancy dress contest for the children, tea in the Stenning Hall and a sale. -------------------------------------- There are three pubs in Hallaton: the {Bewicke Arms,}named after an old local family; the{Fox}by the duckpond; and the{Old Royal Oak}in the High Street. All are frequented by locals, but the Oak is popular with darts players and the Bewicke, picturesque with thatched roof and beams, attracts more outsiders, particularly in the Summer.
